channel.title: Noisering patch
channel.description: I want to share this subpatch with you all. It is an emulation of the Noisering by Grant Richter (available in Eurorack from Malekko Heavy Industry). It uses an 8 bit shift register that gets translated to a voltage (or in our case a 0-255 integer.) The bits get cycled through one step at a time, and the last bit has the possibility of being changed depending on the settings. The "change" knob controls the likelihood that the bit will be changed, and the "chance" knob controls how likely it is to become a 1 or a 0. You just have to give it some kind of clock or trigger input. NoiseRing.axs (10.8 KB) Check it out and have fun! Karl

item.title: Noisering patch
item.dc:creator: @studiokpg Karl Gruenewald
item.description:
@studiokpg wrote:

I want to share this subpatch with you all. It is an emulation of the Noisering by Grant Richter (available in Eurorack from Malekko Heavy Industry). It uses an 8 bit shift register that gets translated to a voltage (or in our case a 0-255 integer.) The bits get cycled through one step at a time, and the last bit has the possibility of being changed depending on the settings. The "change" knob controls the likelihood that the bit will be changed, and the "chance" knob controls how likely it is to become a 1 or a 0. You just have to give it some kind of clock or trigger input.

NoiseRing.axs (10.8 KB)

Check it out and have fun!
Karl
